title: Clinton Body Count Series #5: Woman Set to Testify Against Clintons Blown Up in Home Explosion
text:
New Jersey couple dies in a home explosion. Caroline Paladino was apparently set to testify to Grand Jury against the Clintons this week.. House explosion in New Jersey {Video below}
The couple, John Paladino, 73, and Carole Paladino, 72, were the only people inside the home in Newfield, New Jersey when the blast occurred shortly after 6 a.m.

Flames are seen burning where a New Jersey home exploded early Saturday morning. Two people were killed in the blast, officials said. The cause of the explosion is not currently known. https://t.co/GA3X6tGIjb pic.twitter.com/7wJt79kqte

— ABC News (@ABC) July 7, 2018
Investigators have not revealed what caused the blast but have said they do not suspect any foul play. Neighbors said the couple had lived in their home for decades, and it was where they raised their children.

Just your average run of the mill HOUSE EXPLOSION on a nice Saturday morning in NJ‚Ä¶

News7 link-> https://t.co/DwNz1Yiz7n pic.twitter.com/zHunb4gjKQ

— Rev. Scott Anthony (@ScottAnthonyUSA) July 9, 2018

Wow‚Ä¶another one to add to the long list of deaths associated with the Clinton Crime Syndicate. https://t.co/YEzOprrbih

— Lisa Mei Crowley (@LisaMei62) July 9, 2018
It looks as though we have more lives to add to the Clinton body count.

I catalogued every death I could find if anyone is interested in looking further. More than 200 deaths related to Crooked Hillary and her husband. https://t.co/RdXVONVsZw

— Robert Horan (@Robby12692) July 6, 2018
The expected testimony centered on a notorious pharmaceutical company who gave money to the Clinton Foundation in a bid to cover up their drug price gouging crimes. According to reports, ‚ÄòUS Federal Grand Jury had been impaneled to hear testimony from witnesses presented before it by FBI investigators and/or US Attorneys‚Äô. On July 7th, the report continues, a massive explosion occurred that obliterated a two-story house. The shock wave jolted people from their beds as much as a mile and a half away. ‚ÄòAs per standard protocol and procedures, this report details, SVR analysts, in their replying to the MoD‚Äôs request for information about this ‚Äúevent‚Äù, conducted a database search of the two persons named as having been killed in this explosion‚Äì Carole Paladino, age 72, and her husband John Paladino, age 73‚Äîwith, and very surprisingly to them, a SVR database ‚Äútarget hit‚Äù on Carole Paladino being revealed as she had previously been identified by SVR analysts as being a ‚Äúprobable witness‚Äù against the Clinton Foundation., ‚ÄòNow deceased Carole Paladino was the lead school nurse for Millville Public Schools located in Cumberland County, New Jersey‚Äîand whose inclusion in the SVR‚Äôs database of ‚Äúpotential witnesses‚Äù against the Clinton Foundation was due to her being a ‚Äúcentral identified and named figure‚Äù in the creation of a document titled ‚ÄúTraining Protocols For The Emergency Administration Of Epinephrine‚Äù for the New Jersey Department of Education.‚Äô ‚ÄòEpinephrine (also called adrenaline), this report explains, is a hormone used to treat anaphylaxis‚Äîthat is a serious allergic reaction that is rapid in onset and may cause death‚Äîand whose administering of is done via a medical device known as an epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen)‚Äîand that the Carole Paladino collaborated on report for its ‚Äúemergency administration‚Äù led New Jersey to pass a law requiring all schools in their State, both public and private, to purchase it‚Äîand their passing another law allowing New Jersey school nurses to, also, use EpiPens without parental permission.‚Äô ‚ÄòWhether knowingly, or not knowingly, Carole Paladino, by her being a ‚Äúmain target‚Äù person in the plot to force all New Jersey schools to purchase EpiPens, she became embroiled in one of the largest medical scams ever known in US history‚Äîthat began when the American global generic and specialty pharmaceuticals company Mylan N.V. suddenly began funneling money to the Clinton Foundation‚Äîand that nearly immediately after which, saw Gayle Conelly Manchin take over as the head of the National Association of State Boards of Education‚Äîand who spearheaded an unprecedented effort that encouraged States to require schools to purchase medical devices that fight life-threatening allergic reactions‚Äîthat, in turn, helped pave the way for Mylan N.V., maker of EpiPens, to develop a near monopoly in school nurses‚Äô offices throughout the United States‚Äîwith New Jersey is one of the 11 States drafting laws requiring epinephrine auto-injectors be bought by schools‚Äîand that the Obama-Clinton regime conspired with using their ‚ÄúEpiPen Law‚Äù that gave funding preference to States that did what Gayle Conelly Manchin told them to do.‚Äô ‚ÄòUnbeknownst to the American people, this report notes, is that Gayle Conelly Manchin is the mother of Heather Bresch‚Äîwho, in 2012, right after her mother took control of the National Association of State Boards of Education and began her campaign to force schools to buy EpiPens‚Äîbecame the CEO of EpiPen maker Mylan N.V.‚Äîwith Heather Bresch, upon taking control, raising the price of EpiPens over 400% to $600 per dose and skyrocketing her personal worth to over $27 million‚Äîand whose ‚Äúprotection‚Äù for this vile plot was provided by her father, and Gayle Conelly Manchin‚Äôs husband, Democratic Party US Senator Joe Manchin.‚Äô ‚ÄòTo an even greater scandal-catastrophe awaiting Hillary Clinton, as it dwarfs too near insignificance her EpiPen one, this report further notes, is her ‚Äúactive and knowing‚Äù participation in the United States opioid crisis‚Äîthat the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warns whose drug overdoses attributed to in the US have increased by 13.3 percent from August 2016 to August 2017, and now total 67,344 deaths per year‚Äînearly all of which were deliberately caused by Oxycontin-maker Purdue Pharma‚Äîwho, after funneling tens-of-millions of dollars to the Clinton Foundation, saw the Obama-Clinton regime to a ‚Äúblind eye‚Äù to their flooding of America with opioids‚Äîand as exampled by Democratic Party US Senator Joe Manchin‚Äôs home State of West Virginia being flooded with more than 780 million opioid pills, that roughly equals 433 pills for every man, woman, and child in his State.‚Äô ‚ÄòThis report, after describing the horrific opioid crisis in America, concludes with SVR analysts noting that this past week, also, provided an explanation as to why the FBI task force investigating Hillary Clinton and her Clinton Foundation has been increasing their electronic communications with the United States Attorney‚Äôs Office for the Eastern District of Tennessee‚Äîand that is due to a shocking court case currently underway in Knoxville, Tennessee‚Äîthat was brought against the Clinton Foundation bribed pharmaceutical giant Purdue Pharma by Tennessee Attorney General Herbert H. Slatery III on behalf of the citizens of his State‚Äîand whose shocking to the conscious just released, by order of the court, documents stunningly reveal: ‚ÄúPurdue‚Äôs own records show company founders and executives pressed its sales team to push Tennessee doctors to prescribe deadly dosages of Oxycontin on a long-term basis while lying to doctors about the dangers. Purdue leaders lied to the medical community, politicians and the public not only about the dangers of Oxycontin but created a false narrative ‚Äì that long-term use of opioids didn‚Äôt create addicts but instead caused ‚Äúpseudo addictive‚Äù symptoms. The groups sought to convince the public they had a right to opioids. Tennessee‚Äôs legislature was pushed by one of those advocacy groups to pass a law requiring doctors to prescribe opioids if a patient insisted. Purdue also used fake advocacy literature, such as pamphlets, videos, and social media, to convince the public that long-term use of opioids led to a higher ‚Äúquality of life.‚Äù The firm sent doctors fake literature with similar claims but added material on how Oxycontin ‚Äì Purdue‚Äôs financial rainmaker ‚Äì was better for patients than other opioids on the market.‚Äù Credit: The Event Chronicle Clinton Body Count Series: #1. Another great article! I would like to address something that was mentioned but isn't the topic. Opioid medication. There are people who have chronic diseases that cause life long pain which usually increases as time goes by. To these people, opioid medications are life changing. If prescribed by a responsible doctor who keeps an eye on this patient and routinely checks that this medication is in the patients system and that they are using them not selling them, it is and should always be perfectly okay. People who suffer in this way should not be made to feel dirty or like they are addicts. When it makes the difference between that person being bedridden and pretty much feeling useless and giving them at least part of their lives back. Of course their bodies become dependant on the medication after a while and it would be dangerous to just stop the medication. There's a difference between addiction and a person who suffers severe pain whose body is dependent on the medication because they have been taking for a while. It's inhumane to let people suffer because other people are having problems with addiction. My doctor told me one time that she wouldn't be surprised if the government doesn't make getting opioid medication outside of the hospital almost impossible. Our government doesn't seem to be able to handle anykind of crisis in a wise way. Just for some background I am someone who has someone I love who suffers pain and a different someone I love who suffers from addiction. I want both to get the help they both need but making one suffer because of the other is a ridiculous way to fix it. tadalafil cialis cialis buy Nothing a couple of 50cal rounds wouldn't cure The facts of this story are needles well hidden in haystacks of long paragraphs containing a single run-on sentence. Missing words, misplaced modifiers, wrong words used‚Äî‚Äòtoo‚Äô instead of ‚Äòto‚Äô is just one example‚Äîand the awkward use of twenty words where ten would suffice make this a hard read. This is an important story that needs to be read, and as such, it should have been carefully proofread and edited by someone who knows how. Stories like these lose their credibility when they are poorly written and lack the polish that distinguishes professional journalism.
